str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To stoop, peer in, look down, look intently. From para and kupto; to bend beside, i.e. Lean over.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
From telos; complete; neuter completeness.
From a primary nemo; law, genitive case, specially, (including the volume); also of the Gospel), or figuratively.
Freedom, liberty, especially: a state of freedom from slavery. From eleutheros; freedom.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To remain by, abide with; met: I persevere in. From para and meno; to stay near, i.e. Remain.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
Forgetfulness, oblivion. From a derivative of epilanthanomai; negligence.
A hearer of, a listener to. From akroaomai; a hearer.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.
(a) a maker, poet, (b) a doer, carrier out, performer. From poieo; a performer; specially, a 'poet'.
This; he, she, it.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Happy, blessed, to be envied. A prolonged form of the poetical makar; supremely blest; by extension, fortunate, well off.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A doing, making, performance. From poieo; action, i.e. Performance.
